Subject: Re: [junit] looking for comparision of JUnitEE and Parasoft's JTest

Hi Fazle,

We evaluated Parasoft's Jtest early in 2004. We got representatives presenting
the product to us and helping us with technical questions. 

Obviously the unit tests are just a part of Jtest. So comparing Jtest with a
unit test framework or extension doesn't seem correct. However, we opted not to
use Jtest mostly because of its price (it was around 100,000 Euro (approx.
$120,000) for the whole company) and partially because we liked open source
software solution and wanted to give it a chance.

Our comparison was between Jtest on one side and CruiseControl, JUnit,
CheckStyle, BugFind, PMD, Savant, Clover on the other side. With the exception
of Clover (a great code coverage tool that we use on the server side) our
current system consists of the open source products. We didn't think that Jtest
gave us anything more that was worth $120,000.

Human side and discipline are more important than the tools alone...

I strongly advice to make an assessment of what you expect to get from Jtest
type solutions, then to take some time to evaluate different systems, highlight
the differences and discuss with whoever takes the decisions. If you're not
buying the tool for the right reasons/tasks, it's going to be added to the
unused tools lists.

 - Yagiz Erkan -
 http://yagiz.blogspot.com
 http://www.erkans.com
